poem:
**Changing the Guard**  

In the White House corridors, whispers shift,  
as chess pieces glide across parquet floors.  
A new face at CDC steps in,  
while echoes of the past linger like smoke.  
Kennedy's shadow stretches wide—  
yet duty dances,  
a cautious waltz,  
waiting for the nod from the man upstairs.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "White House picks Kennedy deputy Jim O’Neill to replace fired CDC chief | First Thing Good morning. The White House has chosen a deputy of Robert F Kennedy Jr to serve as the acting head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a decision that comes as lawyers for the fired director, Susan Monarez, claim she will not depart unless Donald Trump himself removes her. A White House official confirmed to the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
